item.title: Guido K√ºhn
item.description: Bleisatz am AbendNeue Schrift in der Setzergasse: Heute im Zuge der Fraktur-√Ñchtung von Unkundigen, aber auf Distinktion Bedachten als Nazi-Schrift missdeutet, war sie als allseits beliebte Auszeichnungs- und Werbeschrift ein bekanntes Gesicht der Weimarer Demokratie. Sagt Hallo zur Wiking, 1925

item.title: Carsen Stringer (she/her)
item.description:

item.title: Dorothy Bishop
item.description:
New! preprint coauthored with Charles Hulme: "When alternative analyses of the same data come to different conclusions: A tutorial using DeclareDesign with a worked real-world example".
We use DeclareDesign to compare 2 analyses of a RCT of Graphogame intervention that came to different conclusions
https://osf.io/preprints/psyarxiv/vzg3e
#intervention #analysis #simulation #literacy

item.title: Spencer LaVere Smith
item.description: I‚Äôve served on award selection committees. It can be hard to identify inspiring recipients that fit the values of the award‚Äôs namesake. Sometimes there are too many to choose from, other times it is hard to populate the shortlist. But this selection is clearly running in a different direction. I can understand why the family is upset. https://www.npr.org/2024/03/15/1238921724/musk-murdoch-rbg-award The Foundation should stop using RBG‚Äôs name.

item.title: Nicole Rust
item.description: Really enjoying this History & Philosophy of science podcast - many episodes are well done. I recommend the episode w/ Hasok Chang and Epistemic Iteration https://thehpspodcast.buzzsprout.com/2180146/14139962

item.title: Andrew Lewis Workshop
item.description: If your door doesn't have a sign like this, do you even science, bro?! Get it from my store: https://www.etsy.com/uk/listing/1412779927/everything-will-kill-you-funny-metal*once again, I stand here as a small business owner and ask you to boost my shenanigans so that I may afford food and shelter.

item.title: Carl T. Bergstrom
item.description: A new arXiv preprint from James Zou suggests that quite a few academics are also using ChatGPT to write their peer reviews. I don't have to explain what an utter shitshow this is going to be, do I?https://arxiv.org/abs/2403.07183

item.title: Mark Humphries
item.description:
Save the date!The UK Neural Computation meeting is back, and in Sheffield for 2024
8 July: ECR day
9-10 July: main meeting11 invited speakers, 4 talks from abstracts and loadsa postersAbstract submission and registration opening soonPls RT!https://neuralcomputation.uk/

item.title: Baron Woke of Carlsberg
item.description: https://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2024/mar/18/man-jailed-ramming-motorcyclist-milton-keynes-bridge-extreme-road-rageIf this level of violence was carried out with anything other than a motor vehicle, the perpetrator would be facing a charge of attempted murder. Four years and ten months jail is an insult and even considering allowing this person to ever drive again is a baffling decision.

item.title: Eugen Rochko
item.description: We've updated the rules of our flagship server mastodon.social today. Most are the same with some clarifications, but one rule is new: Content created by others must be attributed, and use of AI must be disclosed. Profiles that only post AI-generated content will not be tolerated.
